intro: Hellenia bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate helene, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Hellenia bracteata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
